title: Watermelon Salad with Feta Recipe
description: This watermelon salad with feta, arugula, and tomatoes is easy to make for a refreshing summer salad with sweet, salty, peppery flavors in every bite.
body: ​ Skip to content Allrecipes Search Please fill out this field. Search the site Please fill out this field. About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Salad Fruit Salad Recipes Watermelon Salad Recipes Watermelon Salad with Feta 4.8 (46) 34 Reviews 5 Photos This chunky watermelon salad with feta, arugula, red onion, and tomatoes is enjoyed by all. Thanks to the watermelon, the kids like it also! By Allrecipes Member Updated on March 19, 2024 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 5 5 5 5 Prep Time: 20 mins Total Time: 20 mins Servings: 8 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 8 servings 3 tablespoons olive oil 2 teaspoons white balsamic vinegar ½ teaspoon kosher salt 8 ounces grape tomatoes, halved 3 cups arugula 1 cup sliced red onion 2 pounds watermelon, cubed 4 ounces feta cheese, cut into 1/4-inch cubes Directions Whisk olive oil, vinegar, and salt together in a large mixing bowl. Add tomatoes, arugula, and red onion; toss to coat. Gently stir in watermelon and feta cheese to serve. I Made It Print Nutrition Facts (per serving) 131 Calories 8g Fat 12g Carbs 3g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 8 Calories 131 % Daily Value * Total Fat 8g 11% Saturated Fat 3g 15% Cholesterol 13mg 4% Sodium 284mg 12% Total Carbohydrate 12g 5% Dietary Fiber 1g 4% Total Sugars 9g Protein 3g 7% Vitamin C 15mg 17% Calcium 96mg 7% Iron 1mg 3% Potassium 237mg 5% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Watermelon Salad with Feta 01 of 05 Photo by  France C 02 of 05 Photo by  Terry 07/04/2022 I had half of a seedless watermelon that we needed to eat and boy was I glad I chose this recipe to experiment with. Easy recipe, but so delicious and perfect for a Summer meal. Had all the ingredients on hand which made it all the more better. 03 of 05 Photo by  France C 06/15/2022 This was really light and refreshing on this abnormally hot and humid day! If it sits for more than 5-10 minutes, it starts getting very watery. The proportions of ingredients seem to be off, making it a very watermelon heavy salad, with barely any arugula (only 3 cups for 8 servings??). I would cut back on the watermelon by half, and double the arugula next time. There's also too much onion in my opinion. It'd be much easier to state the amount of watermelon in cups, instead of pounds. (For those curious, 2 pounds of watermelon was 2 thick, full slices, or 4 half slices). I thought it needed a touch more salt, and some black pepper, but overall this was a win! 04 of 05 Photo by  Trish Beier 03/10/2011 I love this, a couple things I did different were; I couldn't find just arugula, so I used a spring mix bag salad, and with the dressing I put about a quarter of a pack of Splenda in it, just to sweeten it up a little. Great salad. 05 of 05 Photo by  Trish Beier 03/10/2011 I love this, a couple things I did different were; I couldn't find just arugula, so I used a spring mix bag salad, and with the dressing I put about a quarter of a pack of Splenda in it, just to sweeten it up a little. name: Allrecipes Member
instructions: Whisk olive oil, vinegar, and salt together in a large mixing bowl. Add tomatoes, arugula, and red onion; toss to coat. Gently stir in watermelon and feta cheese to serve.
